contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Jonathan has died in battle" or "The enemy has killed Jonathan" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Jonathan is killed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "David's wives gave birth to six sons" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Sons were born to David

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "No one had tied your hands" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Your hands were not bound

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "No one had attached your feet to chains" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Your feet were not shackled

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "he had more sons and daughters" or "they bore him more sons and daughters" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: more sons and daughters were born to him

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "that his wives bore for him" or "he had" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: who were born to him

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Israel had anointed David as king" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: David had been anointed as king over Israel

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "people told King David" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: King David was told

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "But the slave girls of whom you have spoken will honor me" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: But by these slave girls you have spoken about, I will be honored

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "no one will ever trouble them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: be troubled no more

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "throne" represents the power to rule as king. Alternate translation: "I will cause your descendants to rule over Israel forever" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Your throne will be established forever

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "may you do what you promised to me and my family, and may your promise never change" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: may the promise that you made concerning your servant and his family be established forever

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "is secure because of you" or "continues because of you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: is established before you

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "you will continue to bless my family forever" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: with your blessing your servant's house will be blessed forever

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "when the Arameans realized that the Israelites were defeating them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: When the Arameans saw that they were being defeated by Israel

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "When David heard about this" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: When David was told this

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "The Israelites wounded Shobak the commander of the Aramean army, and he died there" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Shobak the commander of their army was wounded and died there

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "realized that the Israelites had defeated them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: saw that they were defeated by Israel

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "including Uriah the Hittite" or "and the men of the city also killed Uriah the Hittite" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: and Uriah the Hittite was also killed there

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "they killed some of the king's servants" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: some of the king's servants were killed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "they killed your servant Uriah the Hittite" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: your servant Uriah the Hittite was killed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Sometimes men died because of their sins, but he will not die because of his sin with the woman. This can be stated clearly. Alternate translation: "You will not die" or "you will not die because of this sin" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: You will not be killed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "people will name it" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: it will be named

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "They placed the crown on David's own head" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: The crown was placed on David's own head

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "I will take care of this matter for you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: I will command something to be done for you

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "people praised Absalom for his handsomeness more than they praised anyone else" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: there was no one praised for his handsomeness more than Absalom

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "who he had invited" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: who were invited

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "where people once worshiped God" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: where God used to be worshiped

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "when his soldiers kill some of your men" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: when some of your men have been killed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Also, here "all Israel" represents only the Israelite soldiers. Alternate translation: "that you should gather together all of the Israelite soldiers" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-synecdoche]])
contextId.glQuote: that all Israel should be gathered together to you

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Absalom had not followed his advice" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: his advice had not been followed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "they buried him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: was buried

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "There the soldiers of David defeated the army of Israel" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: The army of Israel was defeated there before the soldiers of David

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "so people called it Absalom's Monument from that day on" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: so it is called Absalom's Monument to this very day

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Someone told Joab" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Joab was told

contextId.occurrenceNote: This may be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "After the man took Amasa off the road" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: After Amasa was taken off the road

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "We will throw his head" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: His head will be thrown

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "allow your men to give seven of his descendants to us" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: let seven men from his descendants be handed over to us

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the one whom Yahweh chose" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the one chosen by Yahweh

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "The Gibeonites put them to death" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: They were put to death

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "Someone told David" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: It was told to David

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "whom the Gibeonites executed by hanging" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: who had been hanged

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "who is worthy to receive praise" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: who is worthy to be praised

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "he will save me from my enemies" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: I will be saved from my enemies

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "because God's anger shook them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: and were shaken, because God was angry

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "He appeared on the wings of the wind" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: He was seen on the wings of the wind

contextId.occurrenceNote: This means that the sea water moved and the ocean floor was visible. This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "People could see the channels of the sea" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the channels of the sea were seen

contextId.occurrenceNote: David compares Yahweh's anger to turbulent movements of the ground. "This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Yahweh's rebuke, the breath of his nostrils, laid bare the foundations of the world" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the foundations of the world were laid bare at the rebuke of Yahweh, at the blast of the breath of his nostrils

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Foreigners bowed down to me" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Foreigners were forced to bow to me

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the man whom the God of Jacob highly honored and anointed" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the man who was highly honored, the one anointed by the God of Jacob

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "People often mentioned him when they spoke about the three bravest men" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: He was often mentioned along with the three soldiers

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "people praise him like they praised the three mighty men" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: he was named alongside the three mighty men

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "so that Yahweh will remove this plague from the people" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: so that the plague may be removed from the people

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "God confined the plague that had been on Israel" or "God took the plague away from Israel" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the plague on Israel was confined
